Impulsive book buying....

So I have been in a rather big book slump this week, I have started 5 books and haven’t gotten more then 10 pages into each other. When I went to target, I impulsively bought this book (I mean I had a rough week at work, I totally deserved it right?!) and then came home and actually read! I binged it in a day, and I think it was 100% what I needed!

Do you impulsively buy books?

The Happy Every After Playlist 🎵 

So this story was cute! It’s follows Sloan and Jason, who are in two different places in life. Sloan is still grieving for her fiancé who died two years prior and Jason’s music career is just taking off. They are brought together by Jason’s dog Tucker, who escaped while Jason was out of the country. The book follows their world wind romance. 

I will saw this book definitely discussed topics that were a bit heavier then what I expected in a RomCom. 
Grief/mental health 
Loosing ones self 
Media/corporate exploitation 
Drugs 
Family

I enjoyed it overall. It was a very easy read, and engaging from the first two chapters. Definitely the perfect book to get you out of a funk! 

Oh and there are song recommendations at the beginning of every chapter!

😍 E-BOOKI w Impulsie 😍

👉E-booki czyli książki w wersji elektronicznej - w formie pliku, który można zapisać i odtworzyć na wybranym nośniku: komputerze, laptopie lub tablecie, a nawet na smartfonie 😊

👉Pod względem treści e-booki są identyczne jak ich papierowe odpowiedniki, a więc posiadają okładki, strony, zdjęcia i ilustracje oraz spis treści. 🤩

👉Większość naszych pozycji jest dostępna w formie e-booków. Możesz więc mieć je niemal od razu -  i nie musisz martwić się o ilość miejsca w Twojej domowej biblioteczce 😉

👉 Dla nieprzekonanych mamy dokładną instrukcję, jak  poruszać się w świecie elektronicznych książek 🥰
https://tiny.pl/wmdcw

‼️ POLECAMY ‼️
https://www.impulsoficyna.com.pl/50-e-book

📚book review 📚
•
Paybacks a witch by Lana Harper 
•
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️/5
•
I bought this impulsively from Amazon without really looking at what it was about but I’m so glad I did, this book is amazing!!! 
•
The writing keeps you intrigued the whole way through the story with good little twists and there’s some good laughs throughout and if you’re like me you want to see Gareth hurt and the blackmoore’s taken down a peg. Just a little bit 😂
•
Talia, omfg she is amazing, I loved her from the outset and she just kept getting better. Best book girlfriend I’ve read so far 
•
I highly recommend reading this book it’s brilliant!
•
Hope you all are having a good Easter 
•

Hey book buds! 

It’s been a while, but I had a very relaxing weekend at my grandparents house. I finished CC1, and got started on House of Sky and Breath! No spoilers here, but I’m about 200 pages in and wow SJM is taking us on an adventure. No spoilers in the comments please!

This is my take on the impulse buy challenge that @traveling_pages tagged me in. I tried to only use books that I literally new nothing about while buying them, so that wasn’t too many! 

🌸A Dance With the Fae Prince- I bought this one with A Deal With the Elf King, since I thought they were a duopoly (actually standalones in the same world), but I hardly even read the back cover before purchasing!
🌸The Wisteria Society of Lady Scoundrels- literally bought this yesterday. I liked the cover, the title sounded interesting, and my friend @shelving_and_delving recommended it!
🌸I Was Anastasia- I got this because I’m interested in learning more about the Russian princess Anastasia, and this book takes more of a novel form. Other than that, I know nothing about it!

As always, no pressure if I tagged you, but I’d love to see your takes on this challenge! 

xo, Hailey

***2020 WRAP UP*** 

_____________________ 

I read 36 books throughout 2020. My main goal was to read 45 book in 2020. We all learned this year that our plans are never set in stone, life hits us and we all cope in different ways. Although reading is my escape from the real world, some days I struggled to focus on read and it would go on for a week and then I’d have other things come up. 

For the year of 2021, I am going to allow myself to drop that goal number to a 25 book goal. I saw someone else on IG give themselves a safe number as far as reading( I can’t remember her IG, but I’ll tag when I find her). She does this so she doesn’t stress herself out about reaching her high goal number. I also like it because we are giving ourselves room for reflection , regrouping and working on other projects we may have in mind or have come up. 

_____________________ 

Books not pictured: 
- what my mother doesn’t know 
-Safe 
-Sold

***BOOK COMPLETED/ REVIEW*** 

______________________ 

Book: Impulse 
Author: @ellenhopkinsauthor 
Originally Published: 2007 
Followed by: Perfect 
Genre(s): YA Fiction, mental illness, romance, LGBT, sociology, abuse, poetry, fiction, realistic fiction, novel 
Purchase at: @audible @barnesandnoble @halfpricebooks @thriftbooks @applebooks @target Google Play Books 

______________________ 

Review stars: 5/5 
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 

This book from the very start to finish is packed with so much emotion. The ending was a complete shocker to me, nothing like I thought it was going to be, yet it was something I saw coming but doubted it. I loved this and I’ve decided to go on an Ellen Hopkins binge just as I went on an Madeleine Roux binge. 

______________________
